datasource: Lamberti, Marcello. 1993. Die Shinassha-Sprache. Materialen zum Boro. Heidelberg: Carl Winter Universitätsverlag.[L93]
geodemoTXT: Varieties and subdialects of the Omotic language Shinassha are spoken in Ethiopia, ZZBenishangul-Gumuz region: Metekel zone, near Blue Nile riverZZ; approx 37,500 speakers.

termclusters.label: shn-Verb-Copula-PresentAffirmative
termclusters.note: L93pp.202-209 :: Has only present positive and negative. Past tenses come from ja-,future/jussive from woott-. In some cases adjectives can be directly conjugated like verbs. Cf. also paradigm for fa- éxist

termclusters.label: shn-Verb-Copula-PresentNegative
termclusters.note: L93pp.202-209 :: Has only present positive and negative. Past tenses come from ja-,future/jussive from woott-. In some cases adjectives can be directly conjugated like verbs. Cf. also paradigm for fa- éxist

termclusters.label: shn-Verb-am-AoristHabitualNegativeInterrogative
termclusters.note: L93p.200-202 :: Interrogative forms are made by substituting the interrogative pronominal endings for the non-interrogative in the (otherwise fully formed) non-iterrogative form. Special mention need be made only for the Jussive,aff and neg,and the neg aorHab

termclusters.label: shn-Verb-am-JussiveAffirmativeInterrogative
termclusters.note: L93p.200-202 :: Interrogative forms are made by substituting the interrogative pronominal endings for the non-interrogative in the (otherwise fully formed) non-iterrogative form. Special mention need be made only for the Jussive,aff and neg,and the neg aorHab

termclusters.label: shn-Verb-fa-ConjTns
termclusters.note: L93pp.179-181 ::  fa- 'exist' is an extremely defective verb and seems to have only two tenses

termclusters.label: shn-Verb-fa-Present
termclusters.note: L93pp.179-181 :: fa- 'exist'is an extremely defective verb and seems to have only two tenses

termclusters.label: shn-VerbMonorad-maa-AoristHabitualAffirmativeIndicative
termclusters.note: L93pp.177-179;199-200 :: The verbs listed in the lexeme section all have slight inflectional idiosyncracies in the affirmative. In the negative the inflect regularly on the basis of a special negative stem .

terms: -Ø- ~ -ə- ~ -e-  :  characterized by consonant gradations between indicative stem and imperative stem
